body: thanks!
This will be part of my player branch

Closed by 80abaebe7e2196c88e9a2f7e0bfb815345bf0520

Sorry, I misclicked and didnt make a new branch :(
I believe this is no longer an issue due to how the tracks autoloop now.
PLAYASSSSS
Fixed by #16

As far as limiting the number of tracks that can be added: What if someone has their song in multiple pieces, or what if they have a long set to play? Perhaps we should place a limit on how many can play at a time?
Honestly, if the user plays too many and it gets laggy its their own damn fault. At that point they have 10+ tracks playing at the same time right? They should probably be looking for a higher price audio DAC anyway...
Ah, I must've typo'd. I'm so tired. Im about to fall asleep in here.
Testing and identifying now.
Are you talking about when it glitches for one second and then goes back to normal?
doing this in babyIntro
I thought of this, but decided not to do it since it's already pretty functional as it is.

Volume has already been done

And to be completely honest, I think panning should be pushed back. like I said panning wont be that apparent on laptop speakers, and I feel like it should be more of a priority of release candidate one

I feel like this should be closed, is that okay? How do you feel about that?

True True, it would be their fault for adding 10+ tracks.

However, I think we should limit it to about 6 in that case. since we have #24 if a song is in pieces, they'll remove an old part and place in another or vice versa

Is this at all difficult to do? If it is, I'd understand, but if not, I say it wouldnt hurt. Though, I do feel like this should be implemented, but the priority is possible release canidate 1
this is in finalEffects
the other effects will be tuna based haha
But we will have that BITCRUSHER YESSSSS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This looks great!

There are a few things though.
![screenshot from 2016-02-27 22-19-51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7751154/13377812/768c3a80-dda0-11e5-93a0-faf15f01e028.png)
See how the text is... absolutely giant? We need to figure out why thats so big. I notice it is small on your screen, yet very very large on both Alexis' and my computer screens.

The homepage "Need some help? Click me!"... Could that be a button like the "Open Folder" button on the left sidebar? I think it would look cleaner (think Slack type appearance)

And I realize now when I post that screenshot it does not encompass how EXTREMELY large that text is. Im talking 

# HUGE

(and ^ thats still not even half as big as how it shows up on my screen hahaha)
WOOT

Cool. How about you create an issue for this, and mark it as RC1.
I agree generally, but one distinction I want to make clear:
I believe the program can handle up to 30 tracks loaded in the view at a time. I agree that we should restrict the number to 6 concurrent _playing_ songs.

Sound good?
Sure. Can you create an issue for panning and throw it on the backburner or RC1? I don't want to forget about it, since it is a useful feature that wouldn't take _that_ much effort.
Oh yeah I can fix that
Can I pull in then fix while I'm fixing your icons?
Shweit
Yeah that's cool. Im going to tackle some other JS based things

also, I do agree it's big (I realize my elementary screen always shrunk stuff for me), but I would like somethings on the larger side, since when your performing at night, it usually helps to have a little bit larger text, especially if your using your laptop while standing
Closed via #38
can we higher the priority on this? people love the preeties
Ill rename this one and re-assign it accordingly
